runs.comm: woosh, that's swung almost off the strip - Charles bends double trying to get the toe of his bat on it in vain
slightly back of a length and tighter to the stumps, touch of swing and the ball beats Charles' push
tempting length, swinging away from the right-hander again, this time Charles plays a more authentic leave
straighter, scooting off a leading edge wide of mid-off as the ball moved away from the batsman
touch short and on the stumps, Smith clips smoothly off his pads for four to deep backward square
length outside off, punched to cover
back of a length, on the body and chipped into the leg side
veers down the leg side to begin in the same fashion as Lee
good pace, back of a length outside off and Smith fails to connect with a big heave across the line
pitched up, seaming in, inside-edged on to the batsman's pads
full and straight, Smith clears his feet out of the way and clumps straight to mid-on
length ball, pushed into the gap in front of midwicket - they want two but are forced into a rethink
short ball pulled in muscular fashion over midwicket, it doesn't go all the way but they pick up a couple
room outside off for Charles to swing his arms, the ball pinging away off a thick outside edge to third man
back of a length from Lee and that feeds Smith's brutal hook shot, the ball smashed baseball-style over midwicket for one that isn't coming back anytime soon
pitched up and blocked in front of the stumps
slightly short again and this time Smith perishes! Lee slung a fast delivery well outside off, the batsman tried to cut but got just a sliver of bat on it, Matt Wade taking a comfortable catch
back of a length, defended
more width from Lee, Bonner has a swish, a la Smith, but luckily for him gets nothing on it
back of a length outside off, played short on the off side, the batsmen set off for a run but quickly change their mind as cover-point comes haring in
on the legs, clipped smartly behind square - but there's a fielder in place to collect
defended in front of the stumps and they steal one
goes back and defends a slightly shorter ball into the off side
touch short of a length, outside off, guided down to third man
short ball, Charles gets under it and loop the ball off the splice but short of mid-on
length, cut hard but well fielded at point
length ball outside off and Charles rocks on his haunches, slapping a cross-batted shot back down the ground for four
slower bouncer helped round the corner by the batsman, beating the man inside the circle and scooting to long leg
full bunger on leg stump from Lee, bashed meatily through square leg. Charles is running riot
tip and run to point ... direct hit by the fielder, David Warner. They call for a review but Charles was home
slightly short and wide, similar to the ball that got Smith, but Bonner again fails to connect
tentative play and miss outside off, Bonner playing well away from his body. Doesn't look like he's faced Lee's pace before (imagine being able to say that about a West Indies batsman)
length, outside off, dabbed to third man
room outside off, slid off the face to the same part of the field
Charles advances, McKay responding by sending down a slower ball that follows the batsman, forcing him to wait on the stroke before cutting gently through point
on the stumps, pushed into the off side from back in the crease
length, bit of room outside off, cut into the ground
slower ball, tossed up, tries to drive down the ground but misses, bottom-edging jjust past the stumps along the ground through to Wade
length, pushed out to cover

pitched up, misses with a swipe across the line ... gone! Watson didn't do anything spectacular with that delivery but it was on target and that's sometimes all you need. Charles goes lbw after a colourful cameo
lovely timing, immaculately cover-driving a length ball to the rope
not so pretty that stroke, slashing unsuccessully at a ball that was back of a length and well wide of off stump
pitched up and swinging away from the left-hander, Bravo fails to connect with a full-blooded cut shot
on the stumps, dug out square on the off side
a shot in anger from Bonner! The ball was pitched up, wide of the wicket and clubbed over cover for a one-bounce four
McKay replies by targeting the stumps and is clipped through midwicket for a single
back of a length, banged in at the batsman's body, nudged square on the leg side
full ball, rolled out the back of the hand to take the pace off, miscued to point
rank delivery from McKay, short and well down the leg side, Bonner just needs a tickle off the bat to get four to fine leg
length outside off, dabbed deliberately to third man
slightly full, punched down the ground towards long-on
angled across the batsman, played to point, with Warner again trying to throw down the non-striker's end
leg-stump line, worked to midwicket
full-pitched, driven on the bounce to extra-cover
down the leg side, the ball comes off a glove and dribbles away, Wade fielding to prevent a run
full toss, on the stumps, driven languidly down the ground for another single
length, outside off, cut away in front of point
on the batsman's leg, jabbed to short square
tossed up outside off and driven hard to the cover fielder
flighted again, comes out of the crease to punch a drive to long-off
room outside off, squirted to the sweeper in the deep
full length, not much turn and Bravo smears a cut shot over the head of point. That was really just a thick edge but it had enough on it to beat the chasing fielder
full ball, on the stumps, Bonner manages to squeeze it out on the leg side. Good start from Christian
slightly overpitched, Bravo swings his forearms through an off-drive which flies along the ground to the fielder on the rope
length outside off, punched through cover-point
good length, angled across and seaming a little, beats the outside edge

toe ends a pull shot and Bravo is gone! The ball wasn't quite short enough, Bravo got under it and the catch looped fairly gently out towards deep midwicket, where the fielder had to run a long way in to claim it
dropped into the leg side for a quick single
length, cut straight to the fielder at point
fuller ball, dabbed down to third man for a couple
tossed up on the stumps, straightening, and Bonner top-edges a sweep into the vacant backward square leg area
comes down the wicket, Doherty drags it short and fields off his own bowling
flighted on the stumps, Bonner misses with a slog-sweep ... it thumped the pads but was going down the leg side
leg-stump line, Bonner backs away and drills a shot past cover

bowled him, top of middle! Another wicket for Christian and the wheels are falling off for West Indies! Bonner's somewhat ponderous innings ends with a skip down the wicket, missing with his attempted swipe and seeing his bails go pop
pitched up, driven back past the bowler to long-on
length, played into the leg side by Pollard, pressing forward
Bravo is very active in his crease, taking the ball from outside off to hit down the ground to long-on
length ball, drawing Pollard forward, fizzing past the outside edge
pitched up, in the slot and Pollard nonchalantly smacks a Dorothy straight back down the ground. Such power in those arms ... *sighs*
length, angled in towards the stumps, knocked short on the off side and they scramble one
again targeting the stumps, worked off the pads to short midwicket, more good running garners a single
full, room outside off, Bravo steps out and punches over cover, his bat high over his head as the ball skedaddles away for a boundary
full and on the stumps, turned into the leg side
back of a length outside off, played like a tennis shot on the back foot down to third man
full, driven aerially again, beats the dive of point but is fielded in the deep
on the stumps, out the back of the hand, flicked through the leg side
slower ball outside off, worked away behind point
pitched up, driven wide of mid-on and they run hard for a couple
full length again, whipped through midwicket
more of the same from McKay, Bravo can't get under it and squirts to deep midwicket
full, dug out down the ground to long-on
on leg stump, Pollard plays a delicate fine sweep, like an elephant bending down to pet a mouse
that's huge! Tossed up by Doherty and cannoned back down the ground on to the roof of the pavilion
tossed up on leg-stump and he goes big again, this time drilling a flat six over deep midwicket!
on leg stump again, clipped along the ground this time to deep midwicket
flighted, driven down the ground for one
on the stumps, turning across Pollard, big top edge as the batsman swings murderously, the ball flying high over cover-point - but there was no man out on that side
full, worked into the leg side for one
pitched up, angled towards leg stump and Pollard deposits another vicious six-hit over the leg side boundary
again! full toss, clubbed over deep midwicket, fetch that ... and Pollard is one more boundary from a half-century
gets the yorker length right this time, blocked back to the bowler
up in the blockhole, dug out to deep midwicket
lofted drive and taken at long-off. Bravo doesn't have quite the same muscle as Pollard and he got under a punched shot off a length ball, unable to clear the man in the deep
length ball, drilled out towards long-off
slower ball outside off, Sammy sits in the crease and prods to short extra-cover
pitched up, on the stumps, frees the arms to drive down the ground
full, drifting towards leg stump, shovelled into the leg side - that's fifty for Pollard, incredibly his first in T20Is. It's the fastest by a West Indian too
wide of the stumps, Sammy had back away and misses with a swing
almost a full toss, on the stumps, dobbled to cover
Sammy steps away again, Lee goes wide on the off side, just inside the popping crease - no stroke from the batsman
pitched up, outside leg and glanced down to the rope, easy as you like
shuffles across and scoops a full-pitched delivery through midwicket
superb ball from Lee, yorker-length and hitting Pollard's back leg outside leg stump, the ball rebounding behind point
holes out to long-off! Pitched up by Lee, again well outside off, Sammy wasn nowhere near the pitch and his heave down the ground came off the bottom of the bat
on the stumps, keeps the damage down as Pollard turns to midwicket
full, down the leg side, Pollard edges through his legs for a single
on the legs, nudged deftly to short midwicket and they scamper one
pitched up, on the stumps and drifting further down leg, Pollard swings over the top of the ball and it sails through to the keeper
digs a shot out towards deep midwicket, they try for two but Pollard slips on the way back down ... Baugh makes sure they cross to sacrifice himself
kept low, Pollard can't do much with that and Mathurin will face the final delivery
full, outside the left-hander's off stump, drilled to extra-cover - that takes West Indies to 150
